      • classifyInstance

        public static ClassifiedInstance classifyInstance(weka.classifiers.Classifier classifier,
                                  weka.core.Instance instanceToClassify)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Classifies the instance.
        Parameters:
        classifier - trained classifier
        instanceToClassify - instance for classification
        Returns:
        the classified instance as ClassifiedInstance object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was an error applying the trained WEKA classifier on the given instance. Possible reason: classifier is trained on the different attribute set than the one that describes the instance

      • classifyInstance

        public static ClassifiedInstance classifyInstance(java.util.List<weka.classifiers.Classifier> classifiers,
                                  weka.core.Instance[] instanceToClassify)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Classifies the instance by multiplying the probability output by different classifiers (co-training style classification). Note: separate classifier is expected for each of the views
        Parameters:
        classifiers - array of trained WEKA classifiers
        instanceToClassify - different views of the instance for classification
        Returns:
        the classified instance as ClassifiedInstance object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if:
        (1)there was an error applying one of the trained WEKA classifiers on the given instance. Possible reason: classifier is trained on the different attribute set than the one that describes the instance
        (2)the number of trained classifiers is different from the number of views

      • classifyInstances

        public static ClassifiedInstanceList classifyInstances(java.util.List<weka.classifiers.Classifier> classifiers,
                                       weka.core.Instances[] unlabeledDataset)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Classifies instances by multiplying the probability output by different classifiers (co-training style classification). Note: separate classifier is expected for each of the views
        Parameters:
        classifiers - array of trained WEKA classifiers
        unlabeledDataset - different views of instances to apply classifier on
        Returns:
        the list of classified instances
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if:
        • there was an error applying one of the trained WEKA classifiers on one of the the given instances. Possible reason: classifier is trained on the different attribute set than the one that describes the instance
        • the number of trained classifiers is different from the number of views

      • classifyInstances

        public static ClassifiedInstanceList classifyInstances(weka.classifiers.Classifier classifier,
                                       weka.core.Instances unlabeledDataset)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Classifies instances
        Parameters:
        classifier - trained WEKA classifier
        unlabeledDataset - data to apply classifier on
        Returns:
        the list of classified instances
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was an error applying the trained WEKA classifier on the given instance. Possible reason: classifier is trained on the different attribute set than the one that describes the instance

      • getConfidentInstances

        public static MostConfidentInstances getConfidentInstances(weka.classifiers.Classifier classifier,
                                           weka.core.Instances unlabeledDataset)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Classify instances and return the most confidently labeled ones. The number of most confidently labeled instances per class is defined by the growthSize parameter in co-training.properties.
        Parameters:
        classifier - trained WEKA classifier
        unlabeledDataset - data to apply classifier on
        Returns:
        the list of classified instances
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was an error applying the trained WEKA classifier on the given instance. Possible reason: classifier is trained on the different attribute set than the one that describes the instance

      • performTest

        public static ClassificationResult performTest(weka.classifiers.Classifier classificationModel,
                               weka.core.Instances trainingSet,
                               weka.core.Instances testSet,
                               boolean recordPredictions)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Tests the classifier: trains the given model on a supplied training set and evaluates the performance on the suppled test set.
        Parameters:
        classificationModel - WEKA classification model (untrained classifier)
        trainingSet - data to train the model on
        testSet - test set for the evaluation of the trained model
        recordPredictions - whether to record the classifier prediction (confidences) for each instance
        Returns:
        classification results
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -
        • there was an error training the WEKA classification model on the supplied training set
        • there was an error applying the trained WEKA classifier on the supplied test set. Possible reason: classifier is trained on the different attribute set than the one that describes the test set

      • performTest

        public static ClassificationResult performTest(java.util.List<weka.classifiers.Classifier> classifiers,
                               weka.core.Instances[] trainingSet,
                               weka.core.Instances[] testSet,
                               boolean recordPredictions)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Tests the co-training style combined classifier.
        Training: trains different supervised models on the same supplied labeled set (same instances) but using different views (attribute sets)
        Testing: each instance from the supplied test set is classified in the following way: for each class the probability that the instance belongs to that class is calculated by multiplying the probabilities output by each of the trained models; instance is then assigned the class that has the highest probability
        Parameters:
        classifiers - array of training models to be used (untrained classifiers)
        trainingSet - the different views of the training (labeled) set
        testSet - the different views of the test set to be used for the trained classifier evaluation
        recordPredictions - whether to record the classifier prediction (confidences) for each instance
        Returns:
        classification result
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -
        • the number of training models is different from the number of views
        • there was an error training one of the WEKA classification models on the corresponding view of labeled data
        • there was an error applying one the trained WEKA classifiers on the corresponding view of the test set. Possible reason: classifier is trained on the different attribute set than the one that describes the test set
